title: Sandy Hook Families Reach $73 Million Settlement With Remington Over School Shooting
sub_head: Gun maker reaches a settlement that its marketing practices were in part responsible for 2012 shooting at elementary school in Newtown, Conn.
body:
Remington Arms Co. has reached an agreement to settle claims that its marketing practices were in part responsible for the Sandy Hook school shooting that left 20 children and six staff members dead.
The now-bankrupt gun maker will pay $73 million to the nine families who lost loved ones in the 2012 shooting at the elementary school in Newtown, Conn.
